'''Petilil''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''チュリネ''' ''Churine'') is a {{type|Grass}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Lilligant}} when exposed to a [[Sun Stone]].

==Biology==
Petilil is a plant-like Pokémon that resembles a plant bulb, such as an onion. It is primarily light green. Its head is tipped with three oblong leaves that are very bitter. However, these leaves possess revitalizing effects. Its crescent-shaped white face, seemingly lacking of a nose or mouth, has brown eyes shaped like elongated ovals. A green "bib" is present on its neck, and its lower body consists of five stubs, two of which act as arms, and two more act as legs. It lives in areas with soil abundant in moisture and nutrients. This Pokémon is a female only species with no male counterpart.

==In the anime==
[[File:Petilil M14.png|thumb|left|250px|Petilil in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Petilil made its main series debut in ''[[BW080|Clash of the Connoisseurs!]]'', where [[Ricard Nouveau]] thought it would be a good Pokémon for [[Marigold]]. However, {{an|Cilan}} disagreed, much to Marigold's relief.

A Petilil appeared in ''[[BW095|Unrest at the Nursery!]]'', where it was among the Pokémon that {{OBP|Layla|BW095}} was taking care of.

===Minor appearances===
Petilil debuted in ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]''.

Multiple Petilil appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

Multiple Petilil appeared in ''[[BW118|Secrets From Out of the Fog!]]''.

A Petilil appeared in a fantasy in ''[[BW120|Ash and N: A Clash of Ideals!]]''.

A Petilil appeared in ''[[BW127|The Island of Illusions!]]''.

A Petilil appeared in ''[[BW132|Searching for a Wish!]].''

A group of Petilil appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'' at [[Pokémon Hills]].

A Petilil appeared in ''[[BW134|The Journalist from Another Region!]].''

Two {{pkmn|Trainer}}s' Petilil appeared in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]''.

A Trainer's Petilil appeared in ''[[SM006|A Shocking Grocery Run!]]''.

A Petilil appeared in ''[[SM008|Lillie's Egg-xhilarating Challenge!]]'', where it was among the Pokémon playing in {{an|Lillie}}'s garden. It appeared again in ''[[SM030|The Ol' Raise and Switch!]]'' where it was seen playing with {{AP|Pikachu}}.

A Trainer's Petilil appeared in ''[[SM041|Mounting an Electrifying Charge!]]''.

A Trainer's Petilil appeared in ''[[SM045|Now You See Them, Now You Don't!]]''.

Two Petilil appeared in ''[[SM046|Deceiving Appearances!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Worker Petilil Adventures.png|thumb|125px|Petilil in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the movie adaptations===
A Petilil appeared in ''[[Get Fired Up, Marshadow! (manga)|Get Fired Up, Marshadow!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{adv|Bianca}} befriended a Petilil when she was young, but [[Bianca's father|her father]] forced her to part with her. She appeared in a flashback in ''[[PS464|Black's First Trainer Battle]]''.

A Trainer's Petilil appeared in ''[[PS466|An Odd Speech]]''.

A Petilil appeared in a fantasy in ''[[PS473|Battle at the Museum]]''.

In ''[[PS481|Sandstorm]]'', Petilil appears as one of the Pokémon owned by the {{tc|Worker}}s on {{rt|4|Unova}}.

Petilil later made a cameo appearance in ''[[PS483|Special Delivery]]'' as one of the Pokémon competing in {{ci|Nimbasa}}'s [[Pokémon Musical]].

A Petilil liberated by [[Team Plasma]] appeared in a flashback in ''[[PS529|Pokédex Lecture]]''.

==In the TCG==
{{main|Petilil (TCG)}}

==Other appearances==
===[[Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS/Wii U]]===
Petilil appears the 3DS version as an enemy in Smash Run. It will spray {{m|Sleep Powder}}, putting any players in front of it to sleep.

====Trophy information====
''The leaves on this Grass-type Pokémon's head taste bitter, but eating them is known to refresh a tired body. In Smash Run, it'll disperse purple Sleep Powder over a wide area when it gets close to you. It's easy to get caught off guard by the attack if you're busy fighting other enemies, so if you see a Petilil, take it out as fast as you can. ''

==Trivia==
* Petilil and Cottonee can be seen as counterparts. They both evolve once using a [[Sun Stone]] and share a base stat total of 280. Additionally, Petilil is exclusive to White, White 2, and Moon, while Cottonee is exclusive to Black, Black 2, and Sun. They also have similar movesets.

===Origin===
Petilil is based on the {{wp|bulb}} of a {{wp|Liliaceae}} plant, most likely a {{wp|tulip}}. Its Shiny coloration may be based on {{wp|yellow onion}} or {{wp|Allium moly|golden garlic}} bulbs.

====Name origin====
Petilil may be a combination of ''petal'', ''petite'', or ''{{wp|petunia}}'', and ''{{wp|lily}}'' or ''li'l'' (little).

Churine may be a combination of チュリップ ''churippu'' (tulip), 百合根 ''yurine'' (lily bulb), and 根 ''ne'' (root).
